title: Mamon (Sponge Cakes) Recipe
description: These soft mini sponge cakes are baked in muffin tins, lightly flavored with orange peel and vanilla, and are the perfect snack when craving sweets.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Mamon (Sponge Cakes) 4.8 (31) 26 Reviews 12 Photos These sweet and soft mini sponge cakes are usually baked in small molds and served during snack time. You can use muffin tins if you don't have the molds. Submitted by lola Updated on August 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 12 12 12 12 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 16 cakes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour 1 cup white sugar 1 tablespoon baking powder 1 teaspoon salt ½ cup vegetable oil 8 egg yolks 2 tablespoons grated orange peel 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ⅓ cup orange juice ⅓ cup water 8 egg whites ½ teaspoon cream of tartar ½ cup white sugar Directions Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease 16 muffin cups. Stir flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl until well combined. Make a well in the center and add oil, egg yolks, orange peel, vanilla, orange juice, and water. Mix well by hand until smooth with no lumps. Set aside. Beat egg whites and cream of tartar in a large glass or metal mixing bowl until foamy. Gradually add 1/2 cup sugar, continuing to beat until soft peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: egg whites should form soft mounds rather than a sharp peak. Fold flour mixture into egg whites until incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared muffin cups to about 2/3 full. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack. I Made It Print 60 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 243 Calories 9g Fat 35g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 16 Calories 243 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 12% Saturated Fat 2g 10% Cholesterol 102mg 34% Sodium 269mg 12% Total Carbohydrate 35g 13% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 19g Protein 5g 10% Vitamin C 4mg 4% Calcium 68mg 5% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 86mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Mamon (Sponge Cakes) 01 of 12 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 12 Photo by  Jacqueline Wolfe 05/17/2020 03 of 12 Photo by  sadiengwensmommy 02/27/2018 04 of 12 Photo by  Katie Velasco 12/22/2016 I halfed the recipe, did NOT use the orange zest, replaced orange juice with heavy cream, oil with melted butter, and vanilla extract with almond extract. Baked in a cheesecake tin for 30 min (about 10in circumference). Delicious! 05 of 12 Photo by  Chingkai Sim Tan 02/11/2016 06 of 12 Photo by  Saya Pfeiffer 11/22/2015 I used this recipe this summer, and didn't get a chance to review it till now. I still remember how yummy and moist it was, it was just what I was looking for. I totally recommend using it! I was really happy with final result. It's a lot of batter, though; there was enough to make a medium sized cake and several cupcakes. I piped it using whipped cream, and it was excellent. Definitely a keeper!! :) 07 of 12 Photo by  Trilena Stewart 09/06/2015 08 of 12 Photo by  Glorieme Ninetynine 03/06/2015 09 of 12 Photo by  ONESHOTCHICK 01/03/2013 This was light and flavorful~ I am making this again for sure!! Thank you for the recipe~ 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Mocha Chiffon Cake 5 Ratings Cassava Cake 56 Ratings Barquillos (Wafer Rolls) 20 Ratings Biko 25 Ratings Palitaw (Sweet Rice Cakes) 12 Ratings Ube-Macapuno Cake 51 Ratings Buko (Young Coconut) Pie 8 Ratings Puto 22 Ratings Maja Blanca (Coconut Pudding) 23 Ratings Champorado 11 Ratings Maja Blanca Maiz (Corn Pudding) 7 Ratings Lipardo's Puto Seco 17 Ratings Leche Flan 4 Ratings Passover Lemon Sponge Cake 2 Ratings Serano Chocolate Cake 6 Ratings Outrageously Buttery Crumb Cake 106 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: lola
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease 16 muffin cups.;Stir flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl until well combined. Make a well in the center and add oil, egg yolks, orange peel, vanilla, orange juice, and water. Mix well by hand until smooth with no lumps. Set aside.;Beat egg whites and cream of tartar in a large glass or metal mixing bowl until foamy. Gradually add 1/2 cup sugar, continuing to beat until soft peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: egg whites should form soft mounds rather than a sharp peak.;Fold flour mixture into egg whites until incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared muffin cups to about 2/3 full.;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.
